Plot Sexually Dimorphic Gender Marker Genes

Source: R/AllGenerics.R, R/plotGenderMarkers-methods.R
plotGenderMarkers.Rd

This is a convenience function that wraps plotGene() to quickly plot known sexually dimorphic genes, and overall gene experssion for the X and Y chromosomes. Currently only Homo sapiens and Mus musculus genomes are supported.

plotGenderMarkers(object, ...)

# S4 method for SummarizedExperiment
plotGenderMarkers(object, assay = 1L,
  interestingGroups = NULL, countsAxisLabel = "counts",
  medianLine = TRUE, color = getOption("basejump.discrete.color",
  NULL), legend = getOption("basejump.legend", TRUE), style = "wide")

Arguments

object

Object.
...

Additional arguments.
assay

scalar. Name or index of count matrix slotted in assays(). When passing in a string, the name must be defined in assayNames().
interestingGroups

character. Groups of interest.
countsAxisLabel

string. Label to use for the counts axis.
medianLine

boolean. Include median line for each group. Disabled if samples are colored by sample name.
color

ggproto/ScaleDiscrete or NULL. Desired ggplot2 color scale. Must supply discrete values. When set to NULL, the default ggplot2 color palette will be used. If manual color definitions are desired, we recommend using ggplot2::scale_color_manual(). To set the discrete color palette globally, use options(basejump.discrete.color = ggplot2::scale_color_viridis_d()).
legend

boolean. Show plot legend.
style

string. Plot style.

Value

ggplot.

See also

plotGene().

Other Quality Control Functions: plotCountsPerGene, plotGenesDetected, plotTotalCounts

Examples

data(rse_small)
# Minimal example doesn't contain these genes.
x <- tryCatch(
    expr = plotGenderMarkers(rse_small),
    error = function(e) e
)
#> Error: All genes failed to map: ENSG00000173674, ENSG00000229807, ENSG00000067048, ENSG00000012817, ENSG00000114374, ENSG00000183878
print(x)
#> NULL
